intro: Oxydectes cordiifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaf plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves, which are typically glossy and arranged oppositely along the stems. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink, often blooming in summer. Native to tropical regions, it thrives in warm, humid environments with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for indoor and outdoor gardens.
